body.name: Kabooti Donut Seat Cushion, 3-in-1 Design with Center Cutout for Tailbone Pain, Sciatica and Hemorrhoids
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Wednesday, February 21 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35

features: Foam: 100% Urethane, Cover: 100% Stretch Mesh polyester

COMFORTS TAILBONE INJURIES, SCIATICA, HEMORRHOIDS AND MORE - Perfect for those suffering from sciatica, lower back pain, lumbar pain, numbness, hemorrhoids, piles, postnatal pain, sore tailbone, coccyx pain, perineal wounds, post-surgery recovery, pelvic pain, prostatitis and general seating discomfort.

UNIQUE 3-in-1 DESIGN CATERS TO MULTIPLE PAIN POINTS – Find relief in your most sore and sensitive areas with the all in one design. Combining key features of a ring-shaped donut pillow, tailbone relief cushion, and the standard seating wedge the Kabooti erases the need to purchase multiple seating cushions for each pain point.

BOOST POSTURE AND BREATHING - Breathe deeper, fuller and easier with the patented orthopedic comfort and support of the 3-In-1 Kabooti Seat Cushion. Whenever and wherever you sit, it evenly distributes your weight, tilts your pelvis forward and keeps your spine aligned to open your airways, while helping to prevent muscular aches and body fatigue. Idea for those struggling with posture issues due to spinal stenosis and piriformis syndrome.

PREMIUM HIGH-DENSITY FOAM COMFORT - Unlike ordinary memory foam seat cushions that may flatten out fast, Kabooti is made of premium, high-density, medical grade cushion foam that retains its shape longer for maximum, lasting comfort you can count on. Its high resiliency foam helps keeps your weight evenly distributed, making it the perfect coccyx relief cushion. It gives you better proper posture and a vision boost, too, especially at your home or office computer desk.

COCCYX CUSHION WITH CUTOUTS, CREATES TAILBONE PRESSURE RELIEF - The Kabooti’s custom tailbone cutout relieves tailbone pain providing a pressure free zone for your tailbone and coccyx. Truck drivers, office workers and wheelchair users will find comfort during prolonged sitting with the Kabooti.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2013
reviews.reviewText: Just got it so I'll update after a few weeks of use.First impression is that its well made. High density foam pillow feels like it will return to original shape and not form depressions and lose support as a cheap pillow or cushion will over time. The grey cover is not at all unattractive especially in a business environment such as an office, which is where I use mine. It looks like it belongs and not something I brought from my dining room chair at home. The foam core takes some getting used to...specifically how to place your derriere on the cushion. At first I sat on/over the center hole cutout. After pulling my underwear back in place several times I scooted back towards the rear of the pillow and discovered I had been sitting on the cushion incorrectly. You straddle the center hole and make sure your tailbone is over the coccyx cutout. The hole appears to create space for the side supports to expand into so don't sit in the center hole. Once I squirmed around and discovered how to sit on it, this cushion seems really comfortable and encourages good posture. So far...so good.Update 10/28/13This cushion has made a difference. I'm able to sit much more comfortably given my lower back muscle spasms. I've upgraded to 5 stars.Update 12/5/13I ordered another one of these cushion rings but didn't pay any mind to the seller since the prices were identical. The second cushion came from a different seller and arrived with a sub-standard cover compared to the first one. The cover on the first one (September 27, 2013 review) was well made, had a good fit and a zippered back to remove the cover. The second one arrived with a thin, cheap cover with a sloppy fit and no zipper...just a slot where the cushion fit through. The finish on either side of the opening is nothing more than stitches running the length of the opening and the seam created is already coming apart right out of the box without any use of the cushion. I bought the first cushion with the nice cover from Medical Department Stores. The second with the cheap flimsy cover came from International Coffee and Books (probably should have paid more attention to that one...!). I've returned the item and reordered from Medical Department Stores and emailed the seller to make sure I receive the zippered cover. You should do the same.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Use while riding in our bumpy pickup truck. Helps cushion my back.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Donut hole is covered with fabric
reviews.reviewText: When you have a problem that requires an indentation, you want every millimeter to space to hang in space. The covered hole precludes that. It is very hard sitting on it too.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great pillow that removes coccyx pain
reviews.reviewText: This was a lifesaver! After losing 150 lbs, I lost my butt, and as a result, my tailbone is pretty exposed. Sitting for any length of time gets it sore, and we had a 3000 mile roadtrip coming up. I got a lot of recommendations, and the Kabooti was commonly recommended. I purchased it, and set out on the trip.The cutout shape saved my coccyx. Before, I couldn't drive more than half an hour before I got sore. With this, I had a couple of 12 hour driving days that were just fine.There were only 2 minor drawbacks. First, this was almost too tall for me to use in my car (Jeep Liberty). I have a pretty long torso, and when I sit on this, the top of my head sticks into the sunroof area. But fortunately I could still see ok through the windshield, so it was only a minor annoyance. The other negative was that after a few hours, my butt cheeks would start to get sore. The foam is kind of solid, which is a good thing overall, but after a long time, there was some muscle fatigue that set in. I wonder if a different pillow with a different top (like gel or something) would help alleviate this. However, this only happened on the really long driving days, and I'm sure I would've felt fatigue no matter what I was sitting on.If you are prone to tailbone pain, I highly recommend this pillow. I'll continue to use it a lot in the future.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Provides relief and can use with recumbent exercise bike
reviews.reviewText: I use a recumbent bicycle to help manage low back pain. Unfortunately, all the gyms in my area have bikes that aggravate my hemorrhoids, so I'd had to quit using the bike. A regular pillow or cushion didn't help, as they didn't negate the center ridge that all seats have. The Kabooti has allowed me to resume using a recumbent bike. (It obviously wouldn't work with a regular bike because of the narrow seat. Seats on recumbent bikes are wide enough to support the entire cushion.) I'd also noticed before that my feet were often numb when I finished a bike session; this problem appears to have gone away with the Kabooti. I don't know if that's because of taking the pressure off my tailbone, or because of the slanted seat front taking pressure off my thighs.There is a small mechanical difference when using the Kabooti in this way. The seat being higher requires me to adjust the seat position a little backwards to avoid my knees hitting the console, but that hasn't been a problem for me.I originally purchased the XL Kabooti with an extended seat. I'm overweight (5'11", 275 pounds), so I thought I'd need a wide seat -- not so. I returned the XL, and replaced it with the regular Kabooti, which fits just fine.The Kabooti also works just fine in a chair. :)Some people have complained about the hardness of the cushion. It is firm, but not uncomfortable for me. The indentation, though, seems a little narrow (it's the same width on both cushion sizes). If I don't sit exactly in the center of the cushion, and miss the indentation, then it is hard for the problem area I have.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works really well for "sitting pain" pelvic, sciatica, ulcers, etc!
reviews.reviewText: This is a thoughtful and well made product for my chronic pelvic pain. On balance, it is the most versatile effective product of a dozen or so I have purchased over time, (many much more expensive,) or DIY, improvised for "sitting pain" issues. I have purchased 3 of these. One for home, one for the car, and one for loan to my father-in-law. The cover washes well and fairly easy to put back on. The cushion is firm, lightweight and does not appear to break down. The only problem I have is a tendency to forget it, leaving it in restaurants. But the trip back to retrieve it is well worth it!!!

This cushion is ideal if like me you have had injury to your tailbone. It's discrete in that it looks like any seat cushion and not like a hemroid ring pillow, though that's essentially what it is, with added support for the tailbone.I own 2 now! One I leave in my car, and one I take with me to class (I'm a mature student just returned to college) I couldn't get through my days in class without it!

reviews.reviewTitle: Could be better but not bad at all
reviews.reviewText: It’s not thick as I hoped but it does what it says - it could have been harder on the parts that is supposed to be soft to give a rigid support
El producto fue un regalo, y la verdad que nos comenta que ha sido excelente. Al principio se le hizo raro, pero conforme lo utilizó quedó bastante feliz.

reviews.reviewTitle: Must have - relief from coccyx pain.
reviews.reviewText: Highly comfortable when used over several hours. I use this in my car and i have never been more happier over long drives.
